reviewText: Fabulous!!  If only we had the Tonight Show kinescopes.

I have nothing but praise for the Steve Allen videos in any form.  I would love to own them all at some time.  I use to watch Steve's night time show as often as possible. There is  nothing more to add then what has been said by the other favorable reports here.  However, I have seen all of the later hosts of late night shows.  I find them much less entertaining or original in content.  Frankly, I don't understand why any of them were popular at all.  My only critical comment about Steve's show(as with most early TV) : African American citizens were not given a greater exposure.  Leave it for Dick Cavett and Jack Paar  to fill in this historically racist and sad void(Ed Sullivan's prime time show deserves much credit to showcase black entertainers). P.S. Will there ever be a memorable and acceptable late black talk show host before I leave this planet?
I watched him every night when he was on initially in the 50s.  It remains the best as far as I'm concerned.  Loved all the nutty characters and Steve's laugh was contagious.

There were 156 episodes of the Steve Allen show; this is three of them.  Looks to be a home-made digitization of VHS tapes.

There are other places on the web where you can get comparable quality episodes, but far more for less money.
Great blast from the past. Steve Allen perfected late night. His shows were always good clean entertainment. This disc has good examples of that.
It was really good, but I was looking for the ones from l964-66 when it was from the Vine St. Theater.  I haven't been able to find them.  But it was good and would recommend it.
All of these videos met my expectations fully.  To have any of his original shows available for purchase is a dream come true.
